comment_regular_data.body:
Regarding my comment:

> We could start with that, make it the default (on master), see what breaks, and then decide if it should stay optional.

We won't make it the default on master, until after 0.2 is released.
It's not default yet you have to turn it on by removing the `_` cpoption which is turned on by default.

Would be good to include the references in the commit message:

```
References:
https://github.com/chrisbra/vim-mq-patches/blob/master/cpo_changeword
https://groups.google.com/d/msg/vim_use/aaBqT6ECkA4/ALf4odKzEDgJ
https://groups.google.com/d/msg/vim_dev/Dpn3xtUF16I/T6JcOPKN6usJ
http://www.reddit.com/r/vim/comments/26nut8/why_does_cw_work_like_ce/
```
Added references to the commit message and made it a little more descriptive.
Why would you break compatibility and turn this on by default? That doesn't seem like a good idea at all. A switch should be required to turn this on.
Compatibility with what? If it breaks plugins then we won't make it the default. Enabling it on master would be a way to get feedback on that.

Sorry, compatibility with normal Vim. But I guess if there is consensus to make it default then the community shall rule. I'd have no problem with changing `Y` to `y$` so I guess I contradict myself :)

I agree that making this  default is quite invasive but `vim` chose to maintain compatibility with `vi` here even though the behavior is highly inconsistent. `nvim` has dropped compatibility mode for a reason and I strongly believe that this gives us the chance to right some wrongs that have been made in the past. If one really wants to have inconsistent behavior from a 40 years old editor hiding that behind a flag seems like a viable option. If you are consciously aware of that inconsistency and depend on it, there is a chance that you've already traveled down the rabbit hole far enough to flip a switch to get your old `vi` style back :)

I for one will turn this on for now, to see what breaks ^^.
Apart from the failing tests that do net seem to be related to this change this is ready to go. I'll keep this in sync until @justinmk green-lights it.
Should help text beginning from `:h word|/Special case` also mention this optional behaviour?

Merged.

Users who want to try the new option can do this:

```vim
if has('nvim-0.2')                                                                                                                                        
  set cpoptions-=_                                                                                                                                        
endif
```

repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability.
repo.name: neovim
